references.paper_title: IX. On the problem of the most efficient tests of statistical hypotheses
references.reason: This paper introduces the fundamental Neyman-Pearson lemma, which is a core theoretical basis for the proposed d-GNP algorithm in this paper.

references.paper_title: Predict responsibly: improving fairness and accuracy by learning to defer
references.reason: This paper introduces the seminal work on learn-to-defer, a key concept addressed and extended by this paper.

references.paper_title: Consistent estimators for learning to defer to an expert
references.reason: This paper presents a key previous method in learn-to-defer that this paper improves upon, by addressing multi-objective concerns.

references.paper_title: A plug-in approach to Neyman-Pearson classification
references.reason: This paper provides theoretical grounding for the generalization properties of the proposed post-processing algorithm.

references.paper_title: Equality of opportunity in supervised learning
references.reason: This paper introduces a key fairness constraint, equality of opportunity, which is among those considered and addressed in this paper.
